citation.article-title: Streptomyces atriruber sp. nov. and Streptomyces silaceus sp. nov., two novel species of equine origin
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptomyces atriruber sp. nov.

Streptomyces atriruber (a.tri.ru′ber. L. adj. ater -tra -trum black, dark; L. adj. ruber -bra -brum red; N.L. masc. adj. atriruber blackish-red, referring to the colour of the substrate mycelium and soluble pigments).
Substrate mycelium is very dark red in colour.
Aerial mycelium is white to pinkish white and the spore mass, where produced, is light grey.
Dark red to reddish purple soluble pigments are produced on most media.
Spores are borne on flexuous aerial hyphae (Rectiflexibiles) and are ovoid to cylindrical (0.6–0.7×0.6–1.1 μm) and have a smooth surface.
Adenine, casein, aesculin, gelatin, hypoxanthine, starch, tyrosine, urea and xanthine are hydrolysed, but allantoin is not.
Nitrate reductase is produced; phosphatase is not produced.

Acid is produced on adonitol, l-arabinose, cellobiose, dextrin, d-fructose, galactose, glucose, glycerol, d-mannose, melibiose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, salicin and trehalose, but not on dulcitol, erythritol, inositol, d-lactose, maltose, melezitose, methyl β-xyloside, sorbitol or xylose.
Weak acid production on mannitol and methyl α-d-glucoside.

Grows on adonitol, l-arabinose, cellobiose, dextrin, d-fructose, galactose, glucose, inositol, mannitol, d-mannose, melibiose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, salicin, trehalose and xylose as sole carbon sources and weak growth on sucrose, but no growth on inulin, d-lactose, maltose or melezitose.
dl-Malate, oxalate and l-tartrate are assimilated and acetate, citrate and propionate are weakly assimilated, but benzoate, dl-lactate, mucate and succinate are not assimilated.
Grows on l-asparagine, l-arginine, potassium nitrate, l-serine, l-threonine and l-valine, but not on l-cysteine, l-methionine or l-phenylalanine as sole nitrogen sources.
Growth occurs in the presence of 9 % (w/v) NaCl.
The type strain, NRRL B-24165T (=DSM 41860T=LDDC 6330-99T), was isolated from an equine placenta.
